The TRANSACTION code used on the debit entries when charges are posted. The description and details on this TRANSACTION code affects the way the entries are handled by the system.
Mandatory input.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
Must be the key to a valid entry on the TRANSACTION file.
Must be a Debit TRANSACTION code.

Where an amount is specified to be charged each page (or sheet) of the statement produced, this field allows for the first 1 to 9999 sheets to be free of charge. Hence a system whereby only clients whose statements exceed say 5 sheets would receive an addtional charge for large statements.
Standard Numeric input 1-9999

Charges can be set for each currency and have standard round amounts instead of the current calculated equivalent of the default local amount. This allows say a DEM 15.00 charge to be inposed as standard instead of the equivalent of USD 10.00, which may be DEM 14.55 one day and DEM 15.11 the next.
Fields CURRENCY to MAXIMUM.AMOUNT form a related multi value set.
A maximum of 3 characters may be entered.
Must be the key to a valid entry on the CURRENCY file.

Where charges are being calculated it is possible to place a maximum amount that will be charged to the client, capping any calculated charges to a reasonable amount. This is specific to the currency in this set of fields.
